intro: Arnebia griffithii, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-orange roots, which contain a rich source of alizarin, a natural dye. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pink to red, adding to its ornamental value. Arnebia griffithii is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
